responses_by_article.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the typical size of offering companies that adopt this software business model as described in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Small to medium software firms and spin-offs - Firm A established 1998 (acted as service firm until 2009), Firm B established 2000, Firm C launched 2008 as spin-off, Firm D established 2006 as spin-off from larger software firm
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 3: 'Firm A develops planning and optimization software for telecom operators. The firm, established in 1998, acted purely as a service firm until 2009, when it started to develop its own software product.' | Page 3: 'Firm B, established in 2000, provides interactive gaming platforms and games-on-demand services' | Page 4: 'Firm C was launched in 2008 as a spin-off from a software service firm that provides consulting services related to identity management' | Page 4: 'Firm D was established in 2006 as a spin-off from a larger software firm'

responses_by_article.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the typical size of offering companies that adopt this software business model as described in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Established enterprise software vendors, both incumbents and new players. Examples include large technology corporations (Microsoft, SAP, Amazon, Google, Salesforce.com) and leading regional vendors with thousands of employees.
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1, Section 1: 'traditional software vendors, such as Microsoft and SAP, are also making the transition to cloud-based business models... all IT vendors have already more or less engaged in cloud using diversified strategy, and though the landscape of the vendor market has being shifting towards the new delivery mode, major cloud vendors are still dominated by the incumbents who managed to make the transition with a few exceptions (e.g., Salesforce, Amazon, and Google)' | Page 4, Section 4.2: 'In 2006, ERP Co has grown to a company with 3000 employees... In 2014, ERP Co has 6,000 employees'

responses_by_article.article_title: Digital sustainable business models: Using digital technology to integrate ecological sustainability into the core of business models
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the typical size of offering companies that adopt this software business model as described in the article?
